title: Your First Glimpse of the New "Harry Potter" Play Is Finally Here
text:
​Attention all ​Harry Potter ​fans! Pottermore released the very first look at the new art for the play based on a new story from J.K. Rowling and it's very ​interesting.
​On Thursday afternoon, Pottermore tweeted a look at the poster for "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child Parts I & II."
The official artwork for Harry Potter and the #CursedChild has been revealed: https://t.co/ZN8XJfaytj pic.twitter.com/vhJoGJRJfm
— Pottermore (@pottermore) October 22, 2015
More From Cosmopolitan The artwork has the approval of the author, who seemed to really like it on Twitter.
And I love it! https://t.co/kIW48O4IQ2
— J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) October 22, 2015
On first glimpse, it doesn't really reveal much. But with a closer look at the artwork, you can see a small child in a bird's nest. My spine is tingling already. Rowling has stated firmly that the play is not a prequel , leaving some to speculate the film is a sequel involving Harry and his son Albus. Others think the "cursed child" could be Remus, Voldemort, Snape, Dumbledore, or—I don't know, the kid from this cake video (probably a longshot).
According to Pottermore, the play will debut on London's West End in the summer of 2016. I need a patience and/or time-travelling spell, ASAP. ​
